subSections.title: Kanji
subSections.text:
{{ja-kanji|grade=8|rs=木06}}

# the [[katsura]], the Japanese Judas tree
# the [[cinnamon]] or [[cassia]] tree
# the sweet [[osmanthus]] tree

subSections.title: Readings
Compounds
Etymology 1
subSections.text:
{{ja-kanjitab|かつら|yomi=k}}
From {{etyl|ojp|ja|sort=かつら}}. Originally a compound of {{compound|ja|sort=かつら|香|tr1=ka|t1=fragrance, good smell|出|tr2=zu|t2=to come out, to put something out}} + {{m|ja|ら|tr=ra|pos=nominalizing suffix}}: "that which puts out a good smell", from the way the wood smells good.

subSections.title: Pronunciation
subSections.text: {{ja-pron|yomi=k|かつら|acc=0|acc_ref=DJR,NHK}}

subSections.title: Alternative forms
subSections.text: * {{ja-l|楓}} {{qualifier|uncommon}}

subSections.title: Noun
Derived terms
subSections.text: * {{ja-r|桂男|かつら おとこ}}: the katsura man, a character in the Chinese legend who lives on the moon

subSections.title: Proper noun
Etymology 2
subSections.text:
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|めかつら}}
From {{etyl|ojp|ja|sort=めかつら}}. Alternate spelling for {{m|ja|女桂|tr=mekatsura||female katsura}}, an archaic name for the [[cinnamon]] tree. Compare {{m|ja|男桂|tr=okatsura||male katsura: the katsura tree}}. Appears with this reading in the {{m|ja|和名類聚抄|tr={{w|Wamyō Ruijushō}}}}, a Japanese dictionary of Chinese characters completed in 938.

subSections.title: Pronunciation
subSections.text: {{ja-pron|yomi=k|めかつら}}

subSections.title: Alternative forms
subSections.text: * {{ja-r|女桂|めかつら}}

subSections.title: Noun
subSections.text:
{{ja-noun|めかつら}}

# the [[cinnamon]] tree, or other closely related trees in [[genus]] ''[[Cinnamomum]]''

subSections.title: Synonyms
subSections.text: * {{ja-r|肉桂|にっけい}}

subSections.title: Etymology 3
subSections.text:
{{ja-kanjitab|けい|yomi=o}}
From {{etyl|ltc|ja|sort=けい}} {{m|ltc|桂|tr=kweiH}}.

subSections.title: Pronunciation
subSections.text: {{ja-pron|yomi=kanon|けい|acc=1|acc_ref=DJR}}

subSections.title: Noun
subSections.text:
{{ja-noun|けい}}

# the [[cinnamon]] or [[cassia]] tree
# common name for various other trees in [[family]] [[Lauraceae]]
# in China, the {{m|ja|木犀|tr=mokusei}} or [[sweet osmanthus]] tree

subSections.title: Synonyms
subSections.text:
* {{sense|cinnamon or cassia}} {{ja-r|肉桂|にっけい}}
* {{sense|sweet osmanthus}} {{ja-r|木犀|もくせい}}

subSections.title: Etymology 4
subSections.text:
{{ja-kanjitab|けい|yomi=o}}
From a Chinese legend that the phases of the moon were caused by ''kei'' trees, which would bud, blossom, then drop their flowers and leaves again as if in accelerated seasons.

subSections.title: Pronunciation
subSections.text: {{ja-pron|yomi=kanon|けい}}

subSections.title: Noun
subSections.text:
{{ja-noun|けい}}

# {{lb|ja|sort=けい|euphemistic}} the [[moon]]

subSections.title: Synonyms
Etymology 5
subSections.text:
{{ja-kanjitab|けい|yomi=o}}
Abbreviation of {{m|ja|桂馬|tr=keima}}, the [[knight]] in {{m|ja|将棋|tr=[[shōgi]]||Japanese chess}}.

subSections.title: Pronunciation
subSections.text: {{ja-pron|yomi=kanon|けい|acc=0|acc_ref=DJR|acc2=1|acc2_ref=DJR}}

subSections.title: Noun
subSections.text:
{{ja-noun|けい}}

# the [[knight]] in {{m|ja|将棋|tr=[[shōgi]]||Japanese chess}}

subSections.title: Synonyms
subSections.text: * {{ja-r|桂馬|けいま}}

subSections.title: References
subSections.text:
